title: Severe heatwave alert for 89 mandals in Andhra Pradesh today
content: The Andhra Pradesh State Disaster Management Authority (APSDMA) has issued a ‘severe heatwave’ alert (red) for 89 mandals in the State on March 27 and for 36 mandals on March 28.

title: Anti-terrorist operation resumes in J&K’s Kathua
content: After halting for the night, search parties moved from different directions with the first light of the day on March 28 in J&K’s Kathua

title: Story of mud and water | Review of Rising Sons by Kavery Nambisan
content: Set in a village in the years leading up to Independence, Nambisan’s new novel is about family dynamics and deeply ingrained societal divisions

title: In her Oxford address, Mamata says her governance model doesn't allow discrimination
content: Addressing a gathering at Kellogg College at the University of Oxford on March 27, 2025, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee stressed the importance of inclusive development and stated that division in society is counterproductive.

title: Death’s incomplete draft | Review of M. Mukundan’s novel You, translated by Nandakumar K.
content: The story featuring a septuagenarian protagonist develops as a mystery but the ending feels unsatisfactory

title: China rebuffs Trump offer of tariff concessions if Beijing agrees to TikTok deal
content: Trump told reporters at the White House on Wednesday that he could give China “a little reduction in tariffs or something to get it done”

title: Shivamogga zoo: Shifting focus to education and conservation
content: To motivate more people to adopt animals, the zoo is set to introduce ZooVista project in which visitors are taken on a 3D virtual tour of the facility in an air-conditioned unit

title: The flawed push for a third language
content: While students can study multiple languages privately, it’s not cost-effective to fund the teaching of more than two languages in public schools. When India’s schools struggle with basic proficiency in two languages, enforcing a third without any clear benefits is deeply flawed

title: Uncounted lives at tribal heartland in Andhra Pradesh
content: In the ASR District of Andhra Pradesh, hundreds of children are birthed at home in the tribal settlements deep in jungles and atop hills. Most of these children do not exist on government records and slip through welfare programmes aimed at their uplift. T. Appala Naidu visits a remote hamlet and finds a vulnerable community, whose next generation may miss out on opportunities support they rightly deserve

title: AAP’s Somnath Bharti challenges BJP’s Satish Upadhyay’s election before Delhi HC
content: Mr. Upadhyay defeated Mr Bharti by winning the Malviya Nagar seat in the capital with 39,564 votes in the Delhi assembly elections held in February.

title: Debt, despair and the dark side of online gambling in Telangana
content: Illegal online betting is spreading like wildfire, fuelled by instant loans, aggressive marketing and star-studded endorsements. Given weak enforcement, these platforms ensnare countless users, many of them young, trapping them in a relentless cycle of addiction and debt. While authorities scramble to rein them in, the industry thrives in the shadows, dodging regulations and accountability. Lavpreet Kaur and Naveen Kumar delve into the murky world of this high-stakes digital gamble

title: Bengaluru’s urban boom reshapes villages around it
content: Greater Bengaluru Governance Bill, 2024, proposes to add 24 urbanised villages around Bengaluru to the city’s civic limits. Shreyas H.S. The Hindu visits some of the villages to discover the contrasting realities there

title: Over 68% revolutionaries lodged in cellular prison were from undivided Bengal
content: The Ministry of Culture and Tourism reveals majority of revolutionaries at Andaman Cellular Jail were from Bengal, sparking debate on national monument status

title: BJP stages demonstration against Congress government in Himachal
content: BJP stages ‘Halla Bol’ rally in Shimla against Congress government’s alleged ‘mafia raj’ in Himachal Pradesh

title: Direct flights to start biweekly between Kolkata and London on Mamata’s request: Trinamool
content: A few days prior, the Chief Minister had appealed for a direct flight between Kolkata and London during her meeting with investors at the High Commission of India in London

title: Only 10 PVTGs given habitat rights under FRA in 14 districts of M.P., Odisha, Chhattisgarh
content: Internal MoTA draft report dated to 2020 reveals that many officials continue to confuse habitat rights with the provision of housing or other rights under community forest rights

title: BJP chief in West Bengal praises religious sect in search for votes
content: Prime Minister Modi also greeted the Matua Community on Matua Dharma Maha Mela 2025 and said that the event will showcase the glorious Matua community culture

title: The preacher pulling crowds with promises of healing and miracles
content: Allegations of sexual misconduct against Bajinder Singh, who calls himself a prophet, have not dented the faith of his followers in his Christian mission. They throng his sessions held in a field in Punjab, even as his 3.75-million subscriber base grows on YouTube, finds Vikas Vasudeva

title: Hospitality at the time of adversity
content: It is easy for reporters to become cynical, but every once in a while, people come along to reinforce their belief in humanity

title: Mandatory pregnancy registration sparks privacy concerns in Haryana
content: Order in potential conflict with the existing law on termination of pregnancy and may have unintended consequences, such as driving women to seek unsafe abortions outside the formal healthcare system

title: Reckless policies of LDF, UDF led to fiscal crisis in Kerala: Nirmala
content: Dismissing allegations that the Centre is not sanctioning sufficient funds for the State, the Union Minister says Kerala received ₹1.57 lakh crore between 2014 and 2024, which is an increase of 239% over the UPA period

title: U.S. tariffs: Opposition slams Centre’s ‘inaction’
content: How will the government tackle the issue, ask Rajya Sabha members; Chidambaram seeks discussion in Parliament; Finance Minister says recent reductions in duties are not in response to Trump’s announcements

title: New Bridge over railway line will be ready for public use by April
content: The new bridge will be a lifeline for us as it will connect both sides of Polur town. Tribals from Jawadhu Hills can also easily reach the highway without negotiating traffic in the town, says a resisdent

title: Plea for police probe into Delhi HC judge residence fire to be heard on March 28
content: Petition in Supreme Court seeks FIR against Justice Yashwant Varma for “unaccounted money”, challenges jurisdiction of inquiry committee

title: ‘Policing towards Orwellian 1984’: Union Minister Jayant Chaudhary on U.P. police diktat against street prayers ahead of Eid
content: It was “inappropriate” to threaten those who violated the guidelines with cancellation of passports, says RLD chief; party to stick to its secular character, take independent stance on socio-political issues

title: Kodikunnil Suresh  raises Kodakara money laundering case in Lok Sabha
content: The MP demands an independent and full-fledged inquiry covering all financial trails and political links to ensure accountability

title: Opposition leaders meet Lok Sabha Speaker to air grievances
content: Not allowing Rahul to speak in the House, ‘failure’ to elect a Deputy Speaker among 12 issues raised; parties spoke about ‘exclusion’ of key Ministries from discussion on Demands for Grants

title: Lok Sabha interpreters relay proceedings in real time in 18 languages
content: Apart from the original “floor audio”, MPs, visitors, and viewers on YouTube can choose from English, Hindi, Assamese, Bengali, Bodo, Dogri, Gujarati, Kannada, Maithili, Malayalam, Manipuri, Marathi, Odia, Punjabi, Sanskrit, Tamil, Telugu or Urdu.

title: 16-year-old girl gang-raped in Bihar; 10 youth booked
content: Two arrested; FIR lodged under several sections of BNS including POCSO Act; the villagers are scared after the incident as they say that the main accused is the son of an influential person in the village

title: Samajwadi Party protesters evoke Dalit identity in response to Karni Sena attack on MP’s residence
content: The BJP described the ongoing episode as well-planned strategy of the SP, to orchestrate caste tensions in U.P. and polarise the society

title: Kharge calls on Congress leaders during DCC meeting to unite in fight against BJP
content: Mr. Kharge called for unity among District Congress Committee chiefs, stressed the need to take the fight against the BJP to the streets.

title: Provide more funds to States to implement NEP: House panel to Centre
content: The panel said compliance with the NEP meant that States would have have to spend substantially on provisions such as dual degree, biannual admissions, four-year degree and multidisciplinary universities

title: Part of Bengal border remains unfenced as Trinamool not providing land, says Amit Shah in Lok Sabha
content: The Minister while replying to a question raised by DMK Member Kanimozhi Karunanidhi on government’s policy regarding Tamil refugees said the government has not changed even a “full stop or comma in the policy as existed during the UPA government.”

title: The less talked-about change of nomenclature — from Madras State to Tamil Nadu in 1961
content: Years before the 1968 law to rename the State came into being, the K. Kamaraj government decided to use the title, Tamil Nadu, for the State while referring to it in Tamil. Presenting the Budget for 1961-62, C. Subramaniam said he had substituted Tamil Nadu for Madras in the budget document in line with the February 24, 1961 announcement

title: A communist who dedicated his life to fighting for equality and justice
content: Balu started out as a mill worker. Disillusioned with the British policies, he started organising workers and peasants. Along with five others, he was charged with the murder of a constable and awarded death penalty. He was hanged on February 22, 1951

title: Puliyangudi’s own — a lime with very high citrus level and abundant juice
content: Fighting marauding wild animals from the Western Ghats and the vagaries of nature, farmers of Puliyangudi decided to go in for lemon cultivation in the early 1950s. Its rich red and loamy soil transformed Puliyangudi into the ‘lemon city of India’. The lime, which awaits the Geographical Indication tag, is being sent to almost all the southern States

title: Uddhav Thackeray accuses BJP of abandoning Hindutva for electoral gains
content: Mr. Thackeray reminded PM Modi of his ‘satta jihad’ jibe directed at the Shiv Sena(UBT) during the Maharashtra Assembly election

title: Army conducts tri-service Ex Prachand Prahaar in Arunachal
content: Operations were conducted within an electronically contested environment designed to replicate modern battlefield scenarios.

title: Hike in milk prices affects businesses and households
content: Chethan Hegde, who heads the Bengaluru chapter of National Restaurants’ Association of India, said restaurants and larger chains will be affected owing to the hike

title: Shab-e-Qadr prayers not allowed at Jama Masjid in Srinagar: Mirwaiz
content: Kashmir’s chief cleric Mirwaiz Umar Farooq termed the move of the administration as ‘extremely regrettable’ and ‘condemnable’

title: Nadda calls CMs of BJP-ruled States, senior party functionaries to meet in Delhi
content: Sources in the BJP did not clarify the agenda of the meet, but the process of completing organisational elections within the party before the election of its new national president is continuing

title: Judiciary must intervene when constitutional rights guaranteed to minorities are threatened: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh rules that UGC Regulations, 2018, will not be applicable to minority run educational institutions

title: Make Krishna ID liquor-free district by May 1, says Minister
content: Minister Kollu Ravindra directs officials to raise awareness about the severe health risks associated with the consumption of ID liquor

title: Supreme Court allows Kerala actor’s plea for pre-arrest bail in rape, POCSO case
content: The 55-year-old actor, who was on the run, is also accused of offences under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

title: Kerala government eases procedures to change name in birth certificate
content: Govt. decides that a gazette notification will be enough for a change in the birth registration certificate. As per existing rule, a change in the Class X certificate too is mandatory for the purpose

title: A road washed away in 1924 floods emerges as a major issue in Idukki
content: As protests mount demanding the opening of the old Aluva-Munnar Road, Forest dept. files case against protesters, including a bishop. The road reduces the distance to Mankulam by 20 km

title: Amazon to restore Yamare lake to increase surface area to  21 acres
content: Amazon plans to replenish more than 270 litres of water annually, with the objective to benefit the local community

title: Assam is yet to recognise people who work in portals as journalists, says CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said the arrested reporter Dilwar Hussain Mozumder is a businessman working part-time for a news portal owned by a politician

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. committed to protecting waqf properties, asserts Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Justice has been done to Muslims during the TDP term, and they will be better off under the NDA rule now, he says

title: Freight train derails near Tambaram railway station in Chennai
content: As the freight train was moving at slow speed from Sanatorium station on the shunting line, three empty coaches derailed as it was proceeding towards Tambaram station

title: Giddey's 47-ft, buzzer-beating heave stuns Lakers
content: Josh Giddey heaved a buzzer-beating 47-foot 3-pointer from half-court to cap perhaps the wildest finish in the NBA this season, giving the Chicago Bulls a 119-117 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers on Thursday night.

title: Terps' Willard unsure of future after tourney exit
content: Maryland men's basketball coach Kevin Willard was noncommittal about his future with the Terrapins after they were eliminated by Florida on Thursday in the Sweet 16.

title: Bama sinks record 25 3-pointers, rolls to Elite 8
content: Led by Mark Sears, Alabama broke the 35-year-old record for 3-pointers in an NCAA tournament game Thursday night, making 25 in a 113-88 victory over BYU in an East Region semifinal.

title: With game on line, Soto whiffs to end Mets debut
content: Juan Soto had a chance to deliver tying runs in his much-anticipated Mets debut on Thursday, but he struck out swinging with two outs in the ninth inning to end the Astros' 3-1 win.

title: Arenado soaks in emotional post-HR curtain call
content: Nolan Arenado's eighth-inning homer Thursday had plenty of extra meaning after he spent much of the offseason on the trading block, and Cardinals fans knew it, bringing him out for a curtain call.

title: Ex-Vols coach Pruitt sues NCAA, seeking $100M
content: Former Tennessee football coach Jeremy Pruitt has filed a lawsuit against the NCAA seeking $100 million and claims it conspired with the university to make him a "sacrificial lamb."

title: Ovi, Caps honor Wild's Fleury with handshakes
content: Alex Ovechkin made sure all Capitals players shook hands postgame with retiring Wild goalie Marc-Andre Fleury after Thursday's game.

title: Ex-NFL RB Johnson charged in dogfighting case
content: Former NFL running back LeShon Johnson has been charged in a federal dogfighting case after 190 dogs were seized from him last year.

title: SGA or Jokic for MVP? Answering the biggest NBA awards questions
content: Our insiders break down the biggest NBA awards questions, including the MVP battle between Nikola Jokic and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: 3-pointer problem? Why the NBA has no qualms with it -- yet
content: This season has seen a historic number of 3-point attempts. But does the league really need to rein in the 3s?

title: 2025 MLB predictions: From playoffs and World Series to MVPs and Cy Youngs
content: Can the Dodgers repeat? Who will win MVP? Our experts make their predictions for the 2025 baseball season.

title: Ranking the 25 best players in the women's Sweet 16: From Betts and Bueckers to Strong and Van Lith﻿
content: Does Paige Bueckers, Lauren Betts or Hannah Hidalgo takes over the top spot in our Sweet 16 player rankings?

title: How effects of Michigan hacking are rippling nationwide
content: The allegations have left much of college athletics concerned about what other athletes might be victims.

title: Who's leading the Golden Boot races in Europe's top leagues?
content: Here are the players on top of the Premier League, LaLiga, Bundesliga, Serie A and Ligue 1 scoring charts.

title: UEFA to investigate Mbappé, Vini over Atleti game
content: Four Real Madrid players, including Kylian Mbappé and Vinícius Júnior, are being investigated for alleged "indecent conduct" during the Champions League game at Atlético Madrid, UEFA said on Thursday.

title: Madrid-linked Alonso: Nothing to decide on future
content: In contrast to a year ago, Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso has no offers from rival clubs to prompt any immediate decisions on his future.

title: Barça thrash Wolfsburg 6-1 to reach UWCL semis
content: Defending champions Barcelona cruised to a 6-1 home win over VfL Wolfsburg in the second leg of their women's Champions League quarter-final on Thursday to book a semi-final place with a stunning 10-2 aggregate win.

title: EPL to open transfer window early due to CWC
content: Premier League clubs have agreed to open the transfer window early for a 10-day period in June, ahead of the FIFA Club World Cup, before it reopens again on June 16, the league said on Thursday.

title: Source: City pausing on Echeverri future decision
content: Manchester City are set to wait until the summer before making a decision on Claudio Echeverri's future, a source has told ESPN.

title: Source: PSG owners finalizing Málaga purchase
content: Qatar Sport Investment (QSI), the owner of Paris Saint-Germain, are finalising the purchase of the Spanish club Malaga, a source has confirmed to ESPN.

title: Davies' agent slams Canada staff over ACL tear
content: Alphonso Davies' agent hit out at the player's treatment by Canada staff after it was announced that he has suffered a torn ACL against the United States, saying that the Bayern Munich star was "pressured" to play despite not being fully fit.

title: NWSL: Denver details plans for temporary stadium
content: Denver's NWSL expansion team announced plans Thursday to build a training center and a 12,000-seat temporary stadium in Centennial, Colorado.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Griezmann plans to stay at Atletico, eyes MLS for 2026
content: Antoine Griezmann plans to stay at Atletico Madrid, pushing a potential MLS move to 2026. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Moreno's path to victory over Erceg at UFC Fight Night
content: Brandon Moreno makes his first Octagon appearance of 2025 . the former two-time men's flyweight champion takes on Steve Erceg . moreno, no. 3 in the divisional rankings, lost the title to Alexandre Pantoja in July 2023 .

title: 'Richie's Tater Shots': BYU's Saunders signs NIL deal with company founded by great-grandfather

title: How Calipari's departure led to Kentucky, Arkansas and BYU in the Sweet 16
content: calipari's departure set off a domino effect that rivals anything college basketball has seen over the past decade . the team's second first-round exit from the NCAA tournament in three years . "he's been married 40-plus years, so we're sort of, like, semi-married," coach says .

title: "We'll Be Ruined In 3-6 Months If...": P Chidambaram's Warning On US Tariffs

title: What Madras High Court Told Cops Over Chennai Techie's Harassment Claim

title: 4 Cops Killed In Action, 2 Terrorists Shot Dead In J&K Encounter: Sources
content: Three police personnel have been killed in action during an encounter with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district, sources said on Thursday. Two of the terrorists have also been shot dead while three to four terrorists are still holed up.

title: "Old Relationship With US Is Over": Canada PM Mark Carney
content: The era of deep economic, security and military ties between Canada and the United States "is over," Prime Minister Mark Carney said Thursday, a day after President Donald Trump announced steep auto tariffs.

title: "Passports, Licences Can Be Cancelled": UP Warning Over Namaz On Roads
content: Ahead of Eid-ul-Fitr and last Friday prayers of Ramzan, Meerut Police has issued strict warnings against people offering namaz on roads.

title: Yemen's Houthis Say Launched Missiles At US Aircraft Carrier, Israeli Airport
content: Yemen's Iran-backed Houthis said Thursday they targeted an Israeli airport and army site as well as a US warship, soon after Israel reported intercepting missiles launched from the Gulf country.

title: "Insult To Life Itself": Ghibli Founder Hayao Miyazaki On AI-Generated Art
content: If you have been active on social media, particularly X, in the last 24 hours, it may give you the impression that it's a Studio Ghibli world, and we are living in it. It all has come about, courtesy of OpenAI's latest image-generation update.

title: From Pause To Full Throttle: Trump Resurrects US 6th Gen Fighter Programme
content: Eight months ago, the departing Biden administration halted the ambitious 'Next Generation Air Dominance' fighter programme, citing cost overruns. Trump has revived it.

title: NDTV Explains: Trump's 25% Auto Tariffs. What Are They, Who Is Affected?
content: US President Donald Trump's 25 per cent tariff on automobiles and auto parts imported into that country - and the 25 per cent levy on steel and aluminium imports - mark a significant escalation in a global trade war brewing since he took oath in Jan.

title: VIT holds webinar on careers in data science and deep tech
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! Karnataka Today Your download of top 5 technology stories of the day .

title: Watch: Bengal CM Mamata heckled by student protesters at Oxford University
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee spoke at Oxford University on women's empowerment in Bengal, but was interrupted by students protesting post-poll violence and a controversial case. She emphasized the importance of unity and inclusive development while addressing accusations and challenges raised during her speech.

title: 'Ramadan Mubarak': Trump hosts Iftar dinner at White House; watch video
content: US President Donald Trump hosted the annual Iftar dinner at the White House, expressing gratitude to Muslim-Americans for their support in the November 2024 elections. He highlighted the importance of Ramadan and emphasized his administration's efforts for peace in the Middle East amid ongoing conflicts.

title: BIS raids Amazon & Flipkart warehouses, thousands of substandard products seized
content: Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) conducted raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi, seizing thousands of uncertified products. Over 3,500 electrical goods were confiscated from an Amazon warehouse while 590 pairs of sports footwear were seized from a Flipkart subsidiary. These actions are part of BIS's broader drive to enforce quality standards across the nation.

title: 15 hr-plus Raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Products with fake ISI mark seized
content: BIS conducted raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi and Tamil Nadu, confiscating thousands of substandard products lacking mandatory ISI marks. Items worth approximately Rs 70 lakh and Rs 36 lakh were seized from Amazon and Flipkart, respectively. The raids are part of a nationwide initiative to ensure compliance with quality standards and protect consumers.

title: IPL: Can CSK continue to dominate RCB at Chepauk?
content: Chennai Super Kings face Royal Challengers Bengaluru in a high-stakes match at MA Chidambaram Stadium on Friday. The rivalry is fueled by past encounters and regional proximity. CSK's dominance since 2008 is threatened by RCB's determination led by Virat Kohli and captain Rajat Patidar. CSK's concern is Pathirana's injury, impacting their bowling strength.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens flat; Nifty50 near 23,580
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened flat in trade on Friday. While BSE Sensex was near 77,550, Nifty50 was around 23,580 levels.

title: Amid tension over tariffs, Canada says 'old relationship' with US is over
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has announced a significant shift in the country's relationship with the US, emphasizing the need for economic independence from its neighbour. This comes in response to US tariffs that Carney described as a "direct attack" on Canada's economy, pledging forceful retaliatory measures.

title: Jeff Bezos-Lauren Sanchez wedding: Ivanka Trump, Kim Kardashian & other guests
content: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez are set to marry this summer in Venice, Italy, with invitations sent out for their nuptials at luxury hotels from June 26-29. Their star-studded guest list includes prominent figures like Oprah Winfrey, Kim Kardashian, and Ivanka Trump. Bezos proposed to Sánchez in 2023, over two years after ending his marriage with MacKenzie Scott.

title: 3 cops, 3 terrorists killed in J&K: Hunt was widened after 2 seen asking for water
content: Three terrorists and three police officers were killed, and seven others injured, including a deputy superintendent, in an intense battle in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The clash, involving heavy gunfire and explosions, targeted militants from the Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad group. Operations were halted for the night but will resume at dawn on Friday.

title: Suspected US strikes target Houthi-controlled areas in Yemen
content: Suspected US airstrikes targeted multiple Houthi-held locations in Yemen, including urban and residential areas in Sanaa, leading to undetermined casualties and destruction. The strikes appear to have intensified since March 15, hitting strategic sites like Sanaa International Airport and key regions in Hodeida, Saada, and al-Jawf.

title: China responds to Trump's 'TikTok concession offer': TikTok has always ...
content: US President Trump proposed to reduce tariffs on China in exchange for Beijing's support in selling TikTok's US operations to an American company. The Chinese Foreign Ministry emphasized TikTok's compliance with US regulations and advocated for a fair business environment for global firms.

title: Buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends Larsen and Toubro and Indian Energy Exchange as top stock picks. Nifty is consolidating between 23,800 and 23,200, while Bank Nifty is expected to consolidate between 52,000-50,500.

title: Bengaluru: Man kills spouse, stuffs her into suitcase; arrested near Pune
content: A 36-year-old man, Rakesh Rajendra Khedekar, allegedly murdered his wife, Gouri Anil Sambrekar, in Bengaluru and fled. He called his landlord to report the crime, leading to the discovery of her body in a suitcase. Rakesh was arrested near Pune within 24 hours. The couple had recently moved to Bengaluru from Mumbai.

title: Elon Musk reveals key steps to build a self-sustaining Mars city
content: Elon Musk outlines the requirements for building a self-sustaining Martian city, emphasizing independence from Earth. Key milestones include creating a thriving civilization capable of producing its own resources. Musk anticipates a 20-year timeline and a population of about a million individuals, with SpaceX's Starship playing a crucial role in achieving this vision.

title: Freedom of speech has its limits: Ashwini Vaishnaw backs Kunal Kamra summons
content: Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw supported the summons issued to comedian Kunal Kamra for comments on Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde, underlining the importance of balancing constitutional rights with safeguards. Vaishnaw also announced India's forthcoming introduction of its first indigenous semiconductor chip amid a growing electronics manufacturing sector.

title: Over 500 Indians set for release from UAE prisons ahead of Ramadan
content: Over 500 Indians have been pardoned in the UAE ahead of Ramzan. UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan and Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum have ordered the release of numerous inmates, aiming to alleviate their burdens and foster family stability.

title: Despite SC stay on ‘not-rape’ order, fear stalks UP girl’s family
content: A village in Kasganj remains tense after a Supreme Court observation and Allahabad high court ruling declared that groping a child's breasts over clothing doesn't amount to attempted rape. The victim's family faces ongoing threats and harassment, and has relocated the girl for safety. The legal battle has strained their financial resources significantly.

title: Silent symptoms of magnesium deficiency that can lead to life threatening conditions
content: Magnesium is essential for muscle, nerve function, blood sugar control, and energy production. Deficiency symptoms can be subtle but severe if ignored. Causes include poor diet, digestive disorders, excessive alcohol, and certain medications. Prevention involves eating magnesium-rich foods and reducing stress. Supplements help but consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage.

title: 25% US auto tariff may pinch some Indian companies
content: US President Trump has announced a 25% tariff on imported cars and components, significantly affecting US consumers and potentially inciting retaliation from the EU and Canada. Indian automakers might evade immediate impact, but the auto parts and tyre industries, particularly those with US-export dependencies, could face challenges.

title: IPL: Shardul's fiery spell, Pooran's blitzkrieg propel LSG to win
content: Shardul Thakur's brilliant 4-wicket haul and Nicholas Pooran's explosive 70 off 26 balls guided Lucknow Super Giants to a five-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2025. LSG chased down 191 runs with 23 balls to spare, asserting their dominance in the match. Kishan, SRH’s centurion from the previous game, was dismissed for a golden duck, putting the home side on the back foot.

title: Radical outfit member ‘who incited Nagpur riots’ held
content: Nagpur police have arrested Faizan Khatib, linked to a radical Islamist group, for allegedly instigating riots on March 17. His arrest follows those of Fahim Khan and Hamid Engineer, who are charged with sedition. The riots led to one death and significant property damage.

title: King Charles III hospitalised due to cancer treatment side effects
content: King Charles III, 76, was briefly hospitalized due to temporary side effects from his cancer treatment. While his engagements were postponed, he has returned to Clarence House and remains positive about his recovery. The King’s diagnosis was announced in Feb. 2024, and he has continued to maintain a busy schedule despite his condition.

title: Chiefs face scrutiny after Travis Kelce’s mother drops major Taylor Swift hint
content: Travis Kelce, at 35, returns to the Chiefs, but Noah Gray's rising performance suggests a tight end shift may be necessary. Gray outperformed Kelce last season, and the Chiefs might need to prioritize youth. Also, Donna Kelce celebrates Taylor Swift's successes at the iHeartRadio Music Awards.

title: ‘L2: Empuraan’ box office: Mohanlal starrer opens strong with Rs 22 crore
content: Mohanlal's sequel 'L2: Empuraan' directed by Prithviraj Sukumaran opened powerfully, earning Rs 22 crore across all languages on its first day. The film collected Rs 19.45 crore in Malayalam, with significant success in Kerala's key cities. It received positive reviews for its high production values and narrative, despite a slower second half. ETimes rated it 3.5 out of 5, noting engaging elements but lacking the novelty and punch of its predecessor 'Lucifer'. The movie, however, retains anticipation with fans eager for more.

title: Putin to visit India, boosting Russia-India strategic ties
content: India and Russia's relationship continues to thrive with expanding economic cooperation and trade exceeding $60 billion, despite challenges. Russian foreign minister Sergey Lavrov highlighted India's balanced stance on the Ukraine crisis, while both countries prioritize strengthening their Special and Privileged Strategic Partnership.

title: Passport, DL to be cancelled if namaz offered on streets: Meerut police
content: Meerut police have restricted Eid namaz to designated locations only, warning of legal action for violations. This includes FIRs, potential arrests, and passport or license cancellation. Enhanced security measures include drones and video surveillance. RLD leader Jayant Chaudhary criticized the directive, linking it to George Orwell's dystopian novel, '1984'.

title: Outgunned Maoists recruiting even 9-year-olds as soldiers
content: Maoists in Bastar are reportedly recruiting child soldiers as young as nine years old due to pressure from security forces. A recently discovered letter reveals that 80 of the 130 new recruits are minors, indicating a troubling trend. The organization faces challenges in recruitment and morale issues.

title: Government inks Rs 2,500 crore defence deals
content: The defence ministry signed contracts worth Rs 2,500 crore for Nag anti-tank missile tracked platforms and 5,000 light vehicles for the armed forces. The deals were inked with Armoured Vehicle Nigam Ltd, Force Motors, and Mahindra & Mahindra, enhancing the Army's mechanised infantry capabilities.

title: Caught red-handed: CBI nabs 2 cops taking Rs 2.5L
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has arrested a Delhi Police head constable and a constable for taking a bribe of Rs 2.5 lakh from a complainant. They had demanded Rs 5 lakh to not implicate the complainant in a drug case. The SHO has been suspended.

title: Each Parliament visit to cost Rs 1.5L, Engineer Rashid seeks waiver
content: Jailed MP Abdul Rashid Sheikh, imprisoned under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, has approached Delhi High Court seeking relief from paying Rs 1.45 lakh a day for transportation and security arrangements while attending the Parliament session. Rashid, who won the Baramulla seat from prison, argues that the costs imposed are excessive and beyond his financial capacity.

title: Fear and loathing on US campuses as foreign students face Trump scrutiny
content: Foreign students in the US face a crackdown on political activism, with US universities warned of decertification risks. Detentions include Turkish student Rumeysa Ozturk and Iranian student Alireza Doroudi, sparking fears and distress on campuses. More than 300 student visas have been revoked in a new 'Catch and Revoke' policy.

title: Isro succeeds in 'rolling' SpaDeX satellites, learning key for future docking
content: Isro successfully completed a rolling experiment with its Space Docking Experiment mission, involving circumnavigation of one satellite to verify control over satellite maneuvering. This experiment, crucial for future missions like Chandrayaan-4, will provide valuable data and help Isro validate multiple software and ground station control. More experiments and dockings are planned in the coming months.

title: Has BJP helped Stalin set agenda for Tamil Nadu polls next year?
content: Tamil Nadu's CM M K Stalin has taken up the issues of the three-language policy and proposed Lok Sabha seat delimitation as major poll agendas. By making these state rights concerns and gaining support across party lines, including against the Waqf Amendment Bill, Stalin has effectively set the political narrative ahead of the assembly elections next year.

title: Fired by Musk, hired by Xi: How China is exploiting DOGE layoffs
content: China is exploiting US federal layoffs by using fake job ads and consulting firms to target former government employees, aiming to gather sensitive information. Experts confirm the sophistication of China’s approach, warning that recently terminated employees with key knowledge are particularly vulnerable. This campaign highlights China’s evolving cyber-espionage tactics amid the US government's staffing changes.

title: 'Historical roots': Putin hints at backing Trump's plan to annex Greenland
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin suggested that US President Donald Trump's push to annex Greenland has historical roots, implying potential support for Washington's claims. Trump reiterated the need for Greenland, emphasizing its significance for national security, despite opposition from Danish and Greenlandic leaders.

title: Pak cricket brings the laughs as Butt roasts Iftikhar - Watch
content: In the National T20 Cup semifinal, Iftikhar Ahmed's exuberant celebration after dismissing Kamran Ghulam, and Salman Butt's witty commentary comparing it to taking Viv Richards' wicket, captured attention. Peshawar secured a convincing win with a formidable total of 243 runs, highlighted by Sahibzada Farhan's 148-run innings. Despite Shahzaib Khan's effort, Abbottabad fell short at 187/8.

title: 'If you make me India's coach, I'll make Rohit run 20km'
content: Yograj Singh, former cricketer, defended India’s senior players, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, urging patience amidst their rough patch. Meanwhile, Rohit was seen boating in Jamnagar, following Mumbai Indians' poor start in IPL 2025. MI's skipper Hardik Pandya and bowler Jasprit Bumrah's availability remains uncertain, with Bumrah making progress at the BCCI Centre of Excellence.

title: US Teen Raped, Hands Cut Off. "Animal" Father Arrested After Shootout
content: the body of a 13-year-old girl, Keimani Latigue, was found inside an abandoned home . police shot at and arrested her father on suspicion of raping and murdering her . the girl was found dead in a burned-out, abandoned building a few days before her 14th birthday .

title: "Have Zero Tolerance": US Cancels 2,000 Visa Appointments By "Bots" In India
content: embassy detected major violations in the appointment system by "bad actors" or bots . the embassy is cancelling about 2000 visa appointments made by bots, it says . "we have zero tolerance for agents and fixers that violate our scheduling policies," they add . in 2022, waiting times ranged from 800 to 1,000 days .

title: Watch: British MP asks UK govt to 'formally' apologise for Jallianwala Bagh massacre
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers.
